title: Configure @devlog/web for Vercel Postgres Deployment
description: Set up @devlog/web package to deploy on Vercel using Vercel Postgres as the database backend. This includes configuring the PostgreSQL storage provider, setting up environment variables, creating deployment configuration, and ensuring the web application works properly with cloud PostgreSQL.

notes.content:
Configured Vercel Postgres deployment setup. Key changes:
1. âœ… Created vercel.json with Next.js deployment config  
2. âœ… Added .env.example with Vercel Postgres environment variables
3. âœ… Added pg and @types/pg dependencies to package.json
4. âœ… Created devlog.config.json for PostgreSQL with ${POSTGRES_URL} environment variable
5. âœ… Kept devlog-manager.ts simple - it automatically uses the config file

The core package already supports PostgreSQL storage provider, so we don't need custom storage configuration logic. The ConfigurationManager will automatically load the devlog.config.json and expand environment variables.

ðŸš¨ CRITICAL ISSUE: Monorepo dependency problem for Vercel deployment. @devlog/web depends on @devlog/core (workspace:*) which Vercel can't resolve by default. Need to either:
1. Deploy entire monorepo to Vercel 
2. Use Vercel's turborepo/monorepo support
3. Bundle dependencies before deployment
4. Use a different platform that handles monorepos better

ðŸ’¡ Better approach: Use .env instead of devlog.config.json for flexibility. Environment variables are more standard for deployment and allow easy switching between local/production configs without file changes.

ðŸš¨ ISSUE IDENTIFIED: Vercel deployment failing due to build script conflict. Vercel detects Turbo but vercel.json uses custom pnpm commands instead of Turbo pipeline. Need to fix vercel.json to properly leverage Turbo for monorepo builds.

âœ… SOLUTION IMPLEMENTED: Fixed Vercel deployment build script error. 

ROOT CAUSE: The @devlog/ai package has a CLI binary (`./build/cli/index.js`) that doesn't exist until after build, but pnpm tries to create bin symlinks during install. This caused the original build command to fail.

SOLUTION: Updated vercel.json buildCommand to build dependencies in correct order:
1. `pnpm --filter @devlog/ai build` - builds AI package first
2. `pnpm --filter @devlog/core build` - builds core (depends on AI)  
3. `pnpm --filter @devlog/web build` - builds web (depends on core)

This ensures all workspace dependencies are properly built before the web package build runs.

âœ… FINAL SOLUTION: Fixed Vercel deployment build command successfully.

FINAL VERCEL BUILD COMMAND:
```bash
cd packages/ai && npm run build && cd ../core && npm run build && cd ../web && npm run build
```

KEY INSIGHT: Using `pnpm --filter` from the root directory caused issues with Next.js page collection during build. Using `npm run build` in each package directory (changing working directory) works perfectly.

TEST RESULTS:
- âœ… AI package builds successfully (creates CLI binary)
- âœ… Core package builds successfully (with AI dependency)  
- âœ… Web package builds successfully (46-second Next.js build)
- âœ… All 14 API routes and 4 pages compile correctly
- âœ… No TypeScript errors
- âœ… Build artifacts ready for deployment

The deployment should now work correctly on Vercel.

ðŸŽ¨ CLEANUP: Made build command much cleaner and more maintainable.

BEFORE (ugly):
```json
"buildCommand": "cd packages/ai && npm run build && cd ../core && npm run build && cd ../web && npm run build"
```

AFTER (clean):
```json  
"buildCommand": "npm run build:vercel"
```

CHANGES:
1. âœ… Added `build:vercel` script to root package.json that contains the working build sequence
2. âœ… Updated vercel.json to use the clean `npm run build:vercel` command
3. âœ… Tested - build still works perfectly (47-second build time)
4. âœ… Much more maintainable - build logic is in package.json where it belongs

The Vercel configuration is now clean and professional-looking while maintaining the same functionality.

context.businessContext: Enable cloud deployment of the devlog web interface to make it accessible for remote teams and provide a scalable solution for devlog management. Vercel provides reliable hosting with built-in PostgreSQL integration.
context.technicalContext: The web package currently uses @devlog/core which supports multiple storage backends including PostgreSQL. Need to configure Vercel-specific database connection strings and deployment settings. Vercel Postgres provides managed PostgreSQL with connection pooling.
acceptanceCriteria: Web app successfully deploys to Vercel
PostgreSQL database initializes with proper schema
All devlog CRUD operations work with Vercel Postgres
